body: The PREFIX variable in the makefiles is directly used to construct the install name on the library metadata on darwin.  If not passed, the default /usr/local is used and the resulting librhash.dylib contains usage informaiton of /usr/local/lib/librhash.0.dylib.  This adds the PREFIX= variable directly to the make command so the resulting usage metadata contains the correct valid library path.
title: rhash: Fix broken RPATH info on darwin
